oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Lemuel M. N. Cook requesting return of Confederate prisoners to Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter to Brig. General Hoffman, Commissary General of Prisoners in Washington, DC requesting on behalf of "friends and parents" of prisoners (probably Wilson County men) their return to Tennessee. Prisoners are incarcerated at Point Lookout, DE, Johnsons Island, OH, and Camp Douglas, IL. Cook apparently was a Unionist and had credibility with Federal authorities such that he could recommend leniency for these ex-Confederates.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
